children.subject: (different anon than OP) I'm planning on an internship + classes in the fall, what kind of workload do you think is manageable?

It also depends how much time you will be working. My friend did part-time with 161 and 188. Definitely not more that two technicals and be wise about them (for example, if you take 170 make sure eithee you can succeed with less effort on that class or you can totally do the other one)

Hi, its op here. I’m a us citizen so if I did take the internship I would probably withdrawl and then reapply. Its outta state and not remote so I don’t know if I could still take classes at the same time.
Two things: are you international or US citizen? The second: have you thought about taking classes and working at the same time? (like chiller workload)

history.content:
I was curious if people could share their experiences on doing an internship over the Fall or Spring semester, and having to take a semester off of school to do that.

I got an offer for a software dev internship at a big company for the fall semester. I applied on a whim because I didn't think I'd get in, but I did somehow, and I'm ecstatic because I don't have much developer experience outside of classes and hackathons, and I have no industry experience. 

So on one hand I want to take this opportunity, but I'm also worried I might miss out on more than I'll gain, as I've heard you're unlucky with mentor or team placement it could be an unpleasant experience, the possibility of overwork with this company, being off school for effectively two semesters in a row, and I don't know what the project is yet?

I think in terms of classes, I'm on track and missing a semester will be okay, but I still haven't taken 170 (gonna be a junior lol) and I'll miss out on taking 161 with Weaver this fall which was something I was kinda looking forward to lol cause I heard the class was good.
history.subject: Should I take the Fall Semester off for a co-op internship?
